instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2877: What is 820-2877? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2877</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Screen causing shotdown
threads.message:
No liquid damage. Never worked on one of these.


With no internal screen it runs. Connect screen, there is no backlight and the machine shuts down.
I'm guessing something is detecting and over current or over voltage and shutting the macine down.

This machine is one off of the shit pile. I will get around to looking at the schematic but wondered if anyone had a fast answer for me please?

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2877</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Screen causing shotdown
threads.message: Be aware taht LVDS cable is not the same has <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>..

threads.title: [SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2877</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Screen causing shotdown
[SOLVED]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2877</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Screen causing shotdown
threads.message:
[QUOTE="aprendiz, post: 24072"]Be aware taht LVDS cable is not the same has <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>..[/QUOTE]

Got it one!. I was using a regular 13" test screen with LVDS cable. Changed for the native cable and she works :)
We'll keep that one as a shop machine. Cheers :)
